title: Business Ethics
description: A confession at an H.R. business ethics seminar leads to a dispute between Michael and Holly over whether Meredith should be fired. Dwight tries to prove to Jim how long he can go without taking a personal break.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] Well, I should go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.  I'll tell everybody here that you say hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, don't.  I'm mad at them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not one of them called to congratulate me on our engagement.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah.  That... they might be off the hook for because I... didn't tell them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?  Why not?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just didn't, you know, want a deal.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on, it won't be that bad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.  You know what?  Here we go. [stands up] Uh, everybody?  I just want to make an announcement.  Pam and I are engaged.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [speakerphone] Hi everyone!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I thought you were already engaged.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That was Roy.  She was engaged to Roy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you Angela.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I got a gift for Pam and Roy.  Do I have to get another one?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A little close to my engagement there Tuna, what's your game here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To get married.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [raises hand] She's not a virgin, you know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking in] What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, nothing.  Nothing Michael!  Just saying hi. [Michael waves "hi" at the phone]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: The tall guy got engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Jim] To be married?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep. [Michael hugs/tackles Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Pencils down! [Dwight quickly puts his pencil down] Just kidding, take your time.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Today is ethics day.  After they finish their quiz I'm going to run my first ethics meeting here.  It's gonna be insaaaaane.  No, it's not.  I have to read from the binder.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [trying to assist Michael, who is trying to press play on a CD player] I got it, I got it. [Olivia Newton-John's "Let's Get Physical" starts to play as Holly and Michael jog into the meeting room, dancing]

quotes.speaker: {michael} & {holly}
quotes.text: Let's get ethical!  Ethical!  I wanna get ethical!  Let's get into Ethics yeah!  Let me hear that Dunder Mifflin talk!  Your body talk.  Let me hear your body talk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: WOO!  Alright!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "Why are you helping her?  You're not even dating."  She's my friend... and... ultimately my strategy is to merge this into a relationship... without her even knowing. Uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, let's give it for Miss... Holly Flaaaax! [everyone claps]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Thanks Michael. [Michael groans exhaustingly] Today we're going to have a business ethics seminar because recently, without mentioning any names, there has been some misconduct at corporate and we have a very strict ethics policy and that employee has been fired.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh come on!  He's right there. [points at Ryan] He was hired.  [to Jim] Oh check it out, "Hired Guy."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice. [they bump fists]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ok, elephant in the room.  Let's talk about it.  Do I regret what I did?  Of course I do.  Even though it was an amazing ride, and I'll give you an example.  Anyone see Survivor season six? [Dwight raises his hand] Anyone know Joanna on that show? [Dwight nods] In New York City, I hooked up with a girl who looked exactly like that.  Indistinguishable. So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clapping] Ok.  Well done.  Good speech Ryan, you're a good guy.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Let's start discussing those questionnaires that you filled in this morning.  It is wrong to make personal calls during work hours. Now, some of you marked that you very strongly agree.  But ideally you would have selected totally agree.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I thought very strongly agree sounded stronger than totally agree.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Corporate would like to emphasize that ideally you would all totally agree with that statement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I think we can all totally agree that Holly is totally fantastic. [claps]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Thank you.  In fact, spending a half hour at the water cooler during work hours is a form of stealing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yes, it's called time theft, and it's the same as taking money from the company.  Can anyone think of examples of things that are over the line time wasters?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This meeting.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey-oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Holly] Can't set 'em up like that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why is ok for smokers to take breaks all the time?  If I want to go outside and hang out once an hour, then I'll just take up smoking.  I'll do it.  I don't care.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'll smoke with you.  I got a bag of cigars in my purse.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Stealing office supplies is another big ethical area that there seems to be some confusion about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can we have a moment?  [whispering] Can I talk to you for a sec?  Lot of good stuff. And you look... you look fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What should we be working on while you guys are talking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do some... do some work. [whispering to Holly] People expect a lot from these meetings.  Laughter, sudden twists.  Surprise endings.  You need to be Robin Williams and M. Night Shyamalan.  You need to be Robin Shyamalan.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well, I just have to get through the binder.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you... just... you're kind of losing them.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I am?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, don't think about the stakes.  It'll freak you out.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ok. [to everyone] Michael makes a really good point so, uh, let's just open this up a little bit. Say my name is Lauren and here I am shopping in a supermarket and I steal a pencil.  That's not right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [coughs to hide his words] Lauren, [coughs] enough with the pencils.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, I have to go over pencils and office supplies.  It's part of the ethics thing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That isn't ethics.  Ethics is a real discussion of the competing conceptions of the good.  This is just the corporate anti-shoplifting rules.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'll drop an ethics bomb on you.  Would you steal bread to feed your family? ... Boom!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Exactly, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I took intro to philosophy, twice.  No big deal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a trick question.  The bread is poisoned.  Also, it's not your real family.  You've been cuckolded by a stronger, smarter male.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No that's... not how it works.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would not... steal the bread.  And I would not let my family go hungry.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ok, but we should get back to business.  Have any of you ever faced any ethical dilemmas in the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anybody?  This is a chance for you to say something without any repercussions.  Stanley?  Oscar, come on.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will go first.  When I discovered YouTube I didn't work for five days.  I did nothing.  I viewed Cookie Monster sings Chocolate Rain about a thousand times.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What was the dilemma?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To tell you or not.  And I'm glad I did.  I feel very very good.  Cathartic.  I promise you that you are not going to get into trouble.  You can say anything you want with total and complete immunity.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh-- no no no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, [interrupting gibberish].  Come on, anybody.  Let it fly.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok, once in a while I'll take a long lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A siesta!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Time thief.  Time thief!  Fire him!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, you've really never stolen any company time?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Never!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are a thief of joy.  Anybody else.  Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Sometimes I download pirated music onto my work computer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who hasn't?  Good.  Good!  What else?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No-- I, I'd like to hear more about that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I once reported Oscar to the INS.  Turns out he's clean, but I'm glad I did it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, let's keep this party movin' on.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'll go.  Have you guys ever met Bruce Meyers, the Scranton rep for Hammermill?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bruuuuuuuuuce.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Well for the past six years I have been sleeping with him in exchange for discounts on our supplies and Outback Steakhouse gift certificates.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Jackpot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ach! Wuh--

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Meredith, that is serious.  I mean not only that a conflict of interests, there's also an exchange of goods.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Exchange of steak.  Have you ever had sirloin steak, honey?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's crazy.  That's crazy talk!  Meredith!  The Merenator, sleepin' with suppliers!  Hoo-ooh!  Wow!  What time we got? [checks watch] You know what?  That's a good place to end it.  Right there.  This, I think, was a great ethics seminar.  She has given us a lot of wonderful things to think about.  Right... what is wrong.  Who's to say?  Really.  In the end.  I mean because it is... unknowable.  But, let's give her a round of applause.  Holly, everybody.  Holly!  Get back to work. [everyone applauds, then leaves] [to Holly] Great job.  I am truly impressed.  That, uh, you really pulled that one out.  Classic.  Classic meeting.  We should celebrate.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael, there is some serious issues with Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I mean all of you have done things I wouldn't have done myself but Meredith's actions are really over the line.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nnyeah.  What ya gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: So, regarding this supplier, approximately how many liaisons have there been?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Liaisons, you mean meet-ups?  I don't know, once a month for six years.  Something like that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meredith, why don't you tell Holly... it's not what she thinks.  Nothing unethical happened... and that you just like to sleep around.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Am I in trouble here or something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No... no, this is just a stupid formality.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, it's not a formality.  Now, were these, um, meet-ups just personal?  Unrelated to business?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Nah, I wouldn't have done it if it wasn't for the discount paper.  There's not a lot of fruit in those looms.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ughh!  For the love of God we're trying to help you... stupid bag.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What I don't understand is... why the steak coupons?  I mean, if you were already getting the discounted paper?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Well it's funny.  Maybe it's a girl thing, but after we did it, and he would give me those coupons, I just felt good about myself. [Holly begins to write in her notebook] Hey what's going on here?  I thought I had immunity?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well unfortunately immunity or something being off the record does not really exist in the workplace.  I mean I've never heard of anyone who's kept their job after something like this.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Well... I'm not quitting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [starts a stopwatch as Dwight yawns, stops it when Dwight is done] Yawn.  Four seconds.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh you had said that you don't do anything personal during work time so... I'm just making sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, so wait a minute, you're going to time me every time I yawn?  That's absurd. [Jim smiles and starts the stopwatch] Really? [in a mocking voice] Oh hey look, monkey knows how to use a stopwatch everybody!  He's ti-- [Dwight conceeds and goes back to work, Jim stops the watch]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Personal conversation.  Seventeen seconds.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There is no way that that was-- [Jim starts the watch]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [stops the watch] One second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, well.  Holly... lujah!  It's a miracle, you're at your desk.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's Mike-raculous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hoo-ooh!  Reaching!  You'll get there.  Anyway, I was giving it some thought, and there's no reason that two attractive, good looking, intelligent, funny, attractive people can't, you know, just... sit down and work this whole Meredith thing out.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.  Would you care to bang it out over lunch?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh I already bought this...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh no, no, no.  Your food is no good here, my lady.  [sweeps her food into the trash can, misses]  Sorry!  You know what?  Let's go out!  Dunder Mifflin's treat.  Um, actually you're not a client... so... we'll just split it?  Ethical.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: So, I've gone over corporate policy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you think?  What do you think of this place?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, it's very nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Istn't it?  Yeah, it's kind of... business/romantic.  So you're from Des Moines?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, that sounds so... warm.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: In Summer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here too.  You know what my favorite season is?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Maybe we should talk about Meredith first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, get the boring stuff out of the way.  Autumn was what I was going to say.  When the leaves change.  It's just, I... I think it is the most contemplative of seasons.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ok, so I have gone over this and I have thought about it and I just don't think there is any way I can write a report that doesn't end with her being terminated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, terminator, terminator.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm from da future.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: By any chance, did you see Battlestar Galactica last night?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, I did not.  Was that any good?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually not.  It was really so-so.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. [Dwight turns around, but Jim holds up the stopwatch, threatening to start it]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean I like all the crazy monsters and stuff.  You know, like klingons and wookies and all that but... [Dwight begins to turn around again, Jim holds up the watch] Sorry, was there something you wanted to add, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is that anything like the original Battlestar Galactica?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, it's weird.  It's practically a shot for shot remake.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really? [Dwight closes his eyes, clutches the paper in his hands] Huh, that's cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Story's kinda bland.  It's about this guy named Dumbledore Calrissian who needs to return the ring back to Mordor.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really?  That doesn't sound right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just don't want my employees thinking that their jobs depend on performance.  I mean, what sort of place is that to call home?  And Meredith needs this job.  This is her main source of money.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well, that's very sweet but we have to follow the protocol.  Those are the rules.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, new idea.  We don't report it at all.  We just punish her.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: We punish her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm, tell her she can't have sex for six months.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I don't think we could enforce that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know.  I saw this thing, like a belt with a key.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: A chastity belt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's more of a underwear garment that has little spikes like made of, sometimes they are made of metal.  You know what I am talking about.  You unlock a little door that... down... where you, where you put, where you put the...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He has not stopped working for a second.  At 12:45 he sneezed while keeping his eyes open, which I always thought was impossible.  At 1:32 he peed, and I know that because he did it in an open soda bottle under the desk while filling out expense reports.  And on the flip side, I have been so busy watching him that I haven't even started work.  It's exhausting, being this vigilant.  I'll probably have to go home early today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am just saying that I don't think that you understand what I am saying.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, you are saying that we should sweep it under the carpet, accept the discount on supplies, not fire Meredith and pretend like the whole thing never happened.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What am I saying?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... bleh busted.  I don't...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm saying that her behavior is unethical and a little icky and I don't think I want to work in an environment where that sort of conduct is tolerated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you have to tolerate a lot when you are part of a family.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's not a family.  It's a workplace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will be honest with you.  That car ride did not go well and that was not my fault.  The only reason I am standing out here right now is because I don't want to take the elevator with her.  And I am holding on to her leftovers. [throws Holly's leftovers in the trash]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Dwight walks back to his desk] 19 minutes and 48 seconds.  What were we doing for 19 minutes and 48 seconds?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: None of your business.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So I guess I can assume that was personal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight stares at Angela, buttoning the top button of her blouse] Fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So maybe you're not completely ethical after all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, maybe I'm not. [Dwight grins and gives a sly look at the camera]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's been a little tense.  People are suspicious of me.  And my best friend in the office won't even talk to me. Turns out being the morality police does not make you popular.  I should know because in middle school I was the hall monitor and the kids used to stuff egg salad in my locker.  I was just hoping middle school was over.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kendall from corporate HR is on line one and Holly is on her way in too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's the only thing worse than one HR rep?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Two HR reps.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You get me.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Can I sit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know.  Can you?  Kendall, my main man.

quotes.speaker: Kendall
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] Listen, Holly, Michael, I just got the report that your branch submitted and there's a lot of stuff about a relationship Meredith is having with..

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yes, that came out during the ethics seminar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let the record show that it was during the immunity part of the seminar.

quotes.speaker: Kendall
quotes.text: Well, I'm not sure these circumstances warrant any action.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, I think it is pretty clear that it was unethical.

quotes.speaker: Kendall
quotes.text: Well, from what I can gather it seems like a gray area.  Look, to be honest the company is getting a discount at a tough time in our balance sheet and I don't know that the right thing to do for the company is to turn our noses up at that.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Umm, Kendall, I understand that the discount is good for the company but I'm just not happy about the way we are getting it.

quotes.speaker: Kendall
quotes.text: I thought it was clear with you, Holly.  Your task was to get signatures from the employees showing that they completed the training.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, I understand.

quotes.speaker: Kendall
quotes.text: Every other branch has managed to get this to us so if it's not something you can handle then that's a different discussion.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No.  I can do it.

quotes.speaker: Kendall
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do you tell somebody that you care about deeply, "I told you so."  Gently with a rose?  In a funny way, like it's a hilarious joke?  Or do you just let it go, because saying it would just make things worse? ... Probably the funny way.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Can I have everyone's attention?  Excuse me, may I have everyone's attention, please.  We need to finish the ethics seminar.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No way, lady.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's a trap.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Everyone, please, I just need your signatures to show corporate that I gave you the training.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Don't sign anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, everybody listen up.  If you are not in that conference room in two minutes I am going to kill you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's a quarter to five and I have started to gather my things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get in there right now or I'm gonna lose it! [everyone gets up to go in the conference room]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Am I getting fired?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now is really not the time, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: In this next section we examine the difference between sick days and personal days.  Sick days are only to be used when an illness precludes you form doing your job or can spread to your coworkers.  Personal days, on the other hand, are much more flexible.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Thank you, Meredith, this was delicious.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, where is the steak sauce?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think we're out.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I got some in my minivan somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait a second, how does the steak factor in again?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think she got it as a tip, but I don't know why she didn't just take cash.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't care what she's doing.  I just hope she keeps doing it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Amen.  Just keep the ribs coming.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Stealing office supplies is another big ethical area that there seems to be some confusion about.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's a big ethical area?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Listen, I would love to have an honest conversation with management about ethics.  Why isn't the company doing better?  Mmm... it could be the pad of Post-its I took home last week.  Or it could be the twelve million dollars in deferred compensation in stock options they paid the CEO for a year of substandard performance.  I'm sure we'll cover both in the seminar.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I've done some things I'm not proud of.  Committed some atrocities in Vietnam, uh, two years ago.  Princess Cruise Lines.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: During our honeymoon safari in Africa, Bob and I were driving late at night, and he'd been drinking, and suddenly thump.  We hit something with our jeep.  It was probably a man.  We didn't know what to do.  We heard the police were corrupt and they might beat us, so we just kept driving as fast as we could.  We bribed the airline, got on a plane that night, and fled home.  Maybe it was just an ostrich.  In a soccer uniform.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Have any of you ever faced any ethical dilemmas in the work place?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's keep this rollin'... Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, but you mean other than embezzling?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fraud, Jim, Fraud.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fraud.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Sure, last year you guys were riding me really hard for the website and I just peeled out my Z3 and I knocked the mirror off somebody's car.  I never said a thing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, what?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You knocked the mirror off of my car.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, isn't that messed up?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That guy did a lot of things I'm not proud of.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, when you say "that guy", you mean you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I mean the guy I used to be.  I'm Ryan 2.0 and if it makes you feel any better, that guy did a lot of messed up stuff to me too. [tries to walk away]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, you mean that you did a lot of messed up stuff to you... too?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look, I feel you okay?  That guy took no responsibility for his actions.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But are, are you gonna pay for my mirror?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: If I have to answer for everything that guy did... [shakes head] I'm never gonna move on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It was like two hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We're never going to get what need from that guy. [still shaking head, pats Kevin on the shoulder and walks out of the kitchen]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, anybody see a pair of sunglasses?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Umm... I think I saw some in the kitchen. [toaster oven bell rings, Ryan opens it as smoke rolls out and he see's his melted sunglasses on the tray, Ryan takes cooked sunglasses to Kevin] Oh! I didn't do that.  That was Kevin 1.0, but he hurt a lot of people Ryan, and I can't accept responsibility for what he did. [Ryan walks away and throws his sunglasses in the trash, Kevin smiles]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What are we gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: About what?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Holly.  She's on the warpath.  She is gunning for all our jobs.  Do you guys have any dirt on her?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mmm... sometimes her stockings have a run in them.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No.  Something I can blackmail her with.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: One time I said good morning to her, and she didn't say it back.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Stanley, didn't she say a bunch of racist stuff to you?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No, that was you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You weren't even in the room!  Thanks for nothing.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, how did it go?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, cr..., oh, God.  Meredith, you know what?  I just need a minute, okay?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Okay. [remains sitting]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you need?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'm getting fired, aren't I?  I can't get fired.  I got nothing else.  Nothing.  No skill set.  Can't type, bad on the phone, not great with people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I... really want to keep you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Where else am I gonna get another job that lets me come it at eleven and leave at four?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, what?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I wish Toby was still here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nnnngah!
